text: What's up, everyone?

It's Issac here
with "For The Win."

Now, I get asked a lot
by friends and people I meet

how I first became
a fan of the NBA,

also known as the National
Basketball Association.

Well, I grew up
in Detroit, Michigan,

where my home team
was the Detroit Pistons.

However, my family moved to
Los Angeles when I was younger,

so I guess I just felt like
I could choose any team I liked.

I followed Kyrie Irving
and LeBron James

since their
Cleveland Cavaliers days.
Both incredible players.

And when Kyrie went
to the Nets, that was it.

The Brooklyn Nets
became my team.
But I also still follow LeBron,

and now
the Los Angeles Lakers, too.

If you've ever seen an NBA game
or happen to be interested

but don't have a team yet,
don't worry, I got you covered.

If you're from the west coast,
you could cheer for teams

like the Portland Trail
Blazers, Sacramento Kings,

Golden State Warriors,
Los Angeles Clippers,
and the Los Angeles Lakers.

Across the middle of
the country, there are teams

like the Utah Jazz,
Phoenix Suns,

Denver Nuggets,
Oklahoma City Thunder,
and the Memphis Grizzlies.
Now, if you live down south,
there's the San Antonio Spurs,

Houston Rockets,
Dallas Mavericks,

New Orleans Pelicans,
and across in Florida,

the Orlando Magic
and Miami Heat.

Up north, you've got
the Minnesota Timberwolves,

Milwaukee Bucks, Chicago Bulls,
Indiana Pacers,

Detroit Pistons,
Cleveland Cavaliers.

Then way, way up north,
there's the Toronto Raptors

who are the only
Canadian team in the league,
which is cool.

Literally.
It's very cold up there.

Over on the east coast,
there are a ton of teams

like the Boston Celtics,
Brooklyn Nets,

New York Knicks,
Philadelphia 76ers,

Washington Wizards,
Charlotte Hornets,
and the Atlanta Hawks.

Now I love watching
the Hawks play.
They're an awesome team.

Point guard Trae Young
might be small,

but he can still sink
some insane shots.
Which is another thing.

You know, you don't
always have to support
the team closest to you.

You can pick a team
from anywhere for any reason.

In fact, there are NBA fans
from all around the world

who root for
their favorite teams

across the league,
which is awesome.

Maybe you don't live
near any teams,
but you love New York City.

Well, then you could root for
the New York Knicks.

Or even better, my team,
the Brooklyn Nets.

Or you like bears
and want to cheer
for the Memphis Grizzlies.
Or if you love dinosaurs,

you can root for
the Toronto Raptors.

I also have friends
who like to cheer
for international superstars,

like Giannis Antetokounmpo
from Greece,
Luka Doncic from Slovenia,
Joel Embiid from Cameroon.

And then there are
my Ozzie mates who go crazy

for Patty Mills
from the Brooklyn Nets.

Honestly, there's
a million ways to pick a team,

and there's no wrong way
to do it.
You just have fun with it.

I love watching NBA games
with my friends and family,

whether in person at a game
or on TV.

It is one of the greatest
sports you'll ever see.

So good luck to your team
and enjoy.

See you next time,
and don't forget,

you can watch the NBA
all season long
on ESPN and ABC.
